author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Just a question due to I'm still learning how to work with Linux.

Do I need to uninstall the previous release? I'm using Ubuntu 16.04.

Can some one can provide me with the steps?

Thanks,
Max
## Expected behavior

To properly uninstall the previous package.
## Actual behavior

I don't know how.
## Environment data

Currently on Ubuntu 16.04 PowerShell Alpha 8

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
The `powershell` package is upgradeable, just download the new one and install it. The package manager will update the previous package automatically when you install the new package.

Once the package is installed, if you want to uninstall it (keeping in mind that you do not have to), you can use the `apt-get` [package manager](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AptGet/Howto) to do so: `sudo apt-get remove powershell`.

title: Do I need to uninstall previous PowerShell_Alpha release?
